meanings: brother-in-law (spouse's older brother or older sister's husband)

idioms.meaning: people in the whole world being all brothers
men who have had sex with the same woman

idioms.word: 兄たり難く弟たり難し
idioms.reading: けいたりがたくていたりがたし
idioms.meaning: both people are superb in skill (and thus it is hard to rank them)

idioms.reading: きょうだいはたにんのはじまり

lessons.japanese: 兄弟がいるとどんなだろうといつも思う。
lessons.english: I've always wondered what it'd be like to have siblings.

lessons.japanese: 兄弟がいるとどんなだろうといつも思う。
lessons.english: I've always wondered what it'd be like to have siblings.

lessons.japanese: 「兄弟はいますか？」「いいえ、一人っ子です」
lessons.english: "Do you have any siblings?" "No, I'm an only child."

lessons.japanese: お前と兄ちゃんの見分けがつかないよ。
lessons.english: It is hard to distinguish you from your brother.
